desc: This book describes the prize-winning brain-computer-interface (BCI) projects honored in the community’s most prestigious annual award. BCIs enable people to communicate and control their limbs and/or environment using thought processes alone. Research in this field continues to develop and expand rapidly, with many new ideas, research groups, and improved technologies having emerged in recent years. The chapters in this volume feature the newest developments from many of the best labs worldwide. They present both non-invasive systems (based on the EEG) and intracortical methods (based on spikes or ECoG), and numerous innovative applications that will benefit new user groups
title: Brain-Computer Interface Research: A State-of-the-Art Summary 5 (SpringerBriefs in Electrical and Computer Engineering)
